snippet.textDisplay: Stephen Howson gives a reality check on United's proceedings following a convincing 2-0 defeat to Liverpool. Do you agree?
snippet.textOriginal: Stephen Howson gives a reality check on United's proceedings following a convincing 2-0 defeat to Liverpool. Do you agree?

snippet.textDisplay: Stop moaning about it and face the fact that liverpool signings are working well because of the manager not because those players are world beaters. United went for just overpriced players with no desire to player for the badge but only to become multi millionares. For example raheem sterling left liverpool because he thought club wasnt big enough for him and no doubt he became a better player but liverpool still gonna win the league without him. There was no world class player in liverpool team. Klopp made them good and gave them confidence and desire to win otherwise i will never in my wildest dream would ever think that John Fkn Henderson will be premiere league and champions league winner. But on the other hand united are paying jesse lingard over 100k pounds to not score or assist in more than a year. Because they still think he will improve. That guy is 28 now so hes not gonna improve. Hes not even championship level and united cant sell him because noone will pay more than a bag of chips and a tin of beans nevermind 100k/week. He litrally became millionare doing nothing. Thats a dream job. Thats why united isnt successful anymore. Untied are like arsenal now who just brags about how good they were yrs ago. That time is gone fellas, Now its liverpool and man city time and after a while some other team will be on top. So deal with it.

snippet.textDisplay: After mocking Liverpool for years you will now become Liverpool of past years. No champions league just about getting Europa league and defo no premier league title for another 10 years easy just watch. You are the ac Milan of England. Liverpool will go on to conquer England and Europe and city will challenge them. Everyone else are in a rebuilding phase. United got a lot of work to do to rebuild. Don’t forget other ‘small’ clubs are getting better with each season and will catch up to Uniteds level making it even harder to for united to progress. As long as glazers are in charge you’re staying at the same level

snippet.textDisplay: Look how much United have spent post furg. Pushing past 500mil! Liverpool got a free player, 2 relegated players, players like Ox, Mane and Salah who all had something to prove then lost their best player to Barca but bought Allison (only ready made superstar) and VVD with cash. The net spend is ridiculous towards City and United. BUT the problem can be summed up by Miramino and Bruno F transfers. United should have had him by Jan 7th but they're still messing around...and now Rashford has to play and get injured. United have spent big, brought in ready made superstars but it hasn't worked...so they get kids but fail to back them up with seniors. Nobody in and it's 22nd of January is a JOKE

snippet.textDisplay:
What deadwood has been ruthlessly cleared, exactly? I'll give you Sanchez (and that's only a loan) but Lukaku is firing them in, Smalling is doing well, Herrera's guaranteed a league win and could have an outside chance at the CL and Young just left voluntarily. Meanwhile Jones, Mata, Matic and Lingard all got new contracts. That's a pretty significant pile of kindling there, even without getting into your Pereiras and Pogbas.

To be honest what it's seemed like over the last few years is that Man United are a career speed bump. Players come in doing 100 and change and then BAM - 35 in a 50 zone. Depay, Mkhitaryan, Blind, Di Maria, now Pogba...no wonder Haaland thought he'd better not risk it.
snippet.textOriginal:
What deadwood has been ruthlessly cleared, exactly? I'll give you Sanchez (and that's only a loan) but Lukaku is firing them in, Smalling is doing well, Herrera's guaranteed a league win and could have an outside chance at the CL and Young just left voluntarily. Meanwhile Jones, Mata, Matic and Lingard all got new contracts. That's a pretty significant pile of kindling there, even without getting into your Pereiras and Pogbas.

To be honest what it's seemed like over the last few years is that Man United are a career speed bump. Players come in doing 100 and change and then BAM - 35 in a 50 zone. Depay, Mkhitaryan, Blind, Di Maria, now Pogba...no wonder Haaland thought he'd better not risk it.

snippet.textDisplay: What other great top world football club would “allow” this downward spiral to happen to a club the size of Man Utd. Ferguson & Charlton ...what’s going through their heads watching this slow death of a great club (I’m a Celtic  fan btw) - Have the board just accepted “Mediocrity” now. The longer this is allowed to happen then it’s another year added to even think about challenging for the top spot again. What’s happened to the recruitment. Who sanctioned new contracts for Jones & Young 🙄🙄🙄. Unbelievable the amount of money wasted at United.
snippet.textOriginal: What other great top world football club would “allow” this downward spiral to happen to a club the size of Man Utd. snippet.textDisplay: So glad to see that you're finally being realistic about things because for so long you were so delusional about how good we were and when we would be capable of challenging for titles again which is one of the things that isn't helping at the club - the delusional nature of the fans. Yes, it could easily be 10 years before we win the league again. I remember watching a David Grey Gray interview and he said United was a club that would have prolonged periods of success followed by prolonged periods of failure and I thought at the time that wasn't true but now I believe his theory.
snippet.textOriginal: So glad to see that you're finally being realistic about things because for so long you were so delusional about how good we were and when we would be capable of challenging for titles again which is one of the things that isn't helping at the club - the delusional nature of the fans. Yes, it could easily be 10 years before we win the league again. I remember watching a David Grey Gray interview and he said United was a club that would have prolonged periods of success followed by prolonged periods of failure and I thought at the time that wasn't true but now I believe his theory.

snippet.textDisplay:
De Gea hugely overrated. Couldn’t catch a cold in the Artic with his balls out.
Wan Bassaka just goes flying in to tackles because he’s caught out of position and he’s always last ditch.
Maguire isn’t in the best top 10 CH in the PL.
Shaw finished.
Linderlof wouldn’t get in 15 other PL teams.
Fred would be decent with better players around him.
Perera I don’t know what he his.
Martial is a flat track bully.
Lindgard the worst I’ve ever seen at a so called top club.

Only Rashford, Greenwood, Williams look like potentially good future United players.

Olé out of his depth and the three mentioned above won’t get any better being led by Olé, Phelan and Carrick.

Shambles

snippet.textDisplay: I hope to god that fans understand that Ole isn't the problem. Ole holds this badge to higher standard and that's why he would rather start fro scratch with a whole crop of young talent rather than work with what he had at the moment. It will take time and people need to be patient. I promise you he will bring us back to where we should be. Yes he's not an experienced manager, but if he gets sacked then the club dies it's as simple as that. Once he gets sacked the cycle repeats itself over and over and we will never get anywhere. The manager isn't the problem. It's the culture that surrounds the club for the past 7 years and right now we need someone that can restore the the culture we used to have before ever considering winning titles. There is no short fix, the damage has already been done. But people need to stay behind Ole because he's not the problem.
snippet.textOriginal: I hope to god that fans understand that Ole isn't the problem. Ole holds this badge to higher standard and that's why he would rather start fro scratch with a whole crop of young talent rather than work with what he had at the moment. It will take time and people need to be patient. I promise you he will bring us back to where we should be. Yes he's not an experienced manager, but if he gets sacked then the club dies it's as simple as that. Once he gets sacked the cycle repeats itself over and over and we will never get anywhere. The manager isn't the problem. It's the culture that surrounds the club for the past 7 years and right now we need someone that can restore the the culture we used to have before ever considering winning titles. There is no short fix, the damage has already been done. But people need to stay behind Ole because he's not the problem.

snippet.textDisplay:
The reason recent Liverpool signings have become successful is that they signed with a clear vision and plan. Klopp have a team, a playing style and defined roles/player profiles for the required playing style in his mind and brought these players according to this thought process. He was a proven manager at the league and Europe level and did it before with Dortmund playing very good football with players like Piczcek, Bender, Blaczykowski etc. punching well above their weight. He's doing the same with Henderson, Milner, Wijnaldum etc. That's called good coaching. None of Liverpool players were world beaters before Klopp (actually City released Milner, Henderson was as mediocre as they come, Wijnaldum was a midtable midfielder etc.) and now they are part of a working machine. Fergie did the same for years. He won time and time again with the likes of Fletcher, Brown, O'shea etc.


The impact and importance of a manager is clear to see. We need a top coach more than we need players. We can blame Glazers & the clown named Woodward all we want but at the end of the day they're not the ones who prepares the team and they have spent money. Last summer we were the biggest spenders again. Woodward or Glazers didn't decide to spend most of his budget on a CB who is slower than a turtle and with clear weaknesses in the summer. They didn't decide to ignore the midfield and right wing.


Why this guy says nothing about our clueless manager and refuses to blame him? Because Ole's an ex-United player? We're as bad as Moyes season now but only difference is the mediocrity and the results like that have become acceptable. That's the biggest achievement of Ole and Woodward & Glazers. Lowering the expectations, making everyone believe it's OK to be in this mess. We're lucky that all of City, Chelsea, Spurs, Arsenal, Everton etc. are wank this season and we're not that far behind in the table in terms of position. But that's also misleading as we also could finish as low as 9th or 10th still because the difference in points is just 7 with 14th place now. How's that acceptable for Manchester United? It wasn't under Moyes, Van Gaal or Mourinho but it is now under Ole. Hypocrite & Deluded. We're not getting back from this mess with this kind of delusion and sentimentality. Get a competent manager who is tactically astute and get some quality players.

snippet.textDisplay:
A few years ago I was looking at the size of the Man U squad and there were so many players that I'd remove from the team...fellaini, Valencia, young, Sanchez, matic, smalling, jones, mkhitaryan, darmian etc. Just eating up the wage bill, bringing down the moral and quality of the side.

Slowly we've gotten rid of many of these players. Selling is easy but as we've demonstrated, recruiting the right players is fucking hard. Especially without a sporting director. We should take our time even with a short squad so we don't end up in the same places we've been.
snippet.textOriginal:

Slowly we've gotten rid of many of these players. Selling is easy but as we've demonstrated, recruiting the right players is fucking hard. Especially without a sporting director. We should take our time even with a short squad so we don't end up in the same places we've been.

snippet.textDisplay: being not from the uk i am not sure i agree with your assessment. why had manu success the in the late 90s til 2010's - not because they spend the most money - they had Sir Alex Ferguson . they sold Beckham, Ronaldo, and still did not break them. so its not about being the highest spender - having a great manager is the key. Ferguson and Wenger were once in a generation managers. so are Guardiola and Klopp. kicking out Mourinho was a big mistake - i dont see who they can hire to turn around the situation tbh, both manager or players. same with arsenal. accept mediocracy until then. even Messi or Ronaldo couldn't help u. clap yourself on the shoulder to be commercially succesful - but u wont win for a long time. maybe 30 years like Liverpool or the Dallas Cowboys in the US. and i only see a handful of managers who have the potential to bring u consistently under the top 4; i am not mentioning wining the league. gl

snippet.textDisplay:
It may be longer than 10 years. Older United fans lived through 25 years without a title. United will not win it again until they have an elite manager. That could be 10, 15, 20 years. It’s already 7 years since United last won it.
In the meantime, we will win the odd cup, domestic and Europa league, and have lots of excitement. But there will be no dominance.
snippet.textOriginal:
It may be longer than 10 years. Older United fans lived through 25 years without a title. United will not win it again until they have an elite manager. That could be 10, 15, 20 years. It’s already 7 years since United last won it. 
In the meantime, we will win the odd cup, domestic and Europa league, and have lots of excitement. But there will be no dominance.

snippet.textDisplay:
6 mins in the video and I can't understand the point he is trying to make...
Load of mumbo jumbo about owners, then talking about recruitment and saying how ruthless ole has been in getting rid of 'deadwood.' (simply not true)
Then finally some bs about Pogba being world class is laughable.
What was the actual point that was being made?
You have a lot more deadwood now in buying british players as they are simply not good enough.
And as for a management issue... Glazers were fine for fergie, they spend 150 million nearly every window... So the issue is not them. I would sack ole as he is not taking you anywhere to be honest.

What was the actual point that was being made? 
You have a lot more deadwood now in buying british players as they are simply not good enough. 
And as for a management issue... Glazers were fine for fergie, they spend 150 million nearly every window... So the issue is not them. I would sack ole as he is not taking you anywhere to be honest.

snippet.textDisplay: It hurts to love United right now
snippet.textOriginal: It hurts to love United right now

snippet.textDisplay: As in Liverpool has more or so twice the points we have and guys are still saying we give Ole time , you know Woodward is sitting somewhere drinking wine with the glazers saying “this fools bought this Ole crap, you get a legend and this will divide the fans, and we still making money “ Herrera said this club is no longer interested in performances and that’s why he went to a club that is fighting for something, yet we have fans still saying Ole in and that is why pogba wants to go , Ole is a quick fix. No one should be attending this home games and filling this guys pockets , this guys have a weakness which is money so make them loose it then they will react. Otherwise we are sitting down and they playing us , Klopp was sarcastic saying we will finish top 4 but I don’t think so , TAKE A STAND, SACK OLE NOW

snippet.textDisplay: 10 years? Jurgen Klopp showed you dont need 10 years to build a title-winning squad. All we need are proper scouting system, capable CEO, and manager. I like Ole and i think hes done everything right so far, but our scouting system and CEO are a joke. How can we missed players like Mane Salah, van Dijk, Maguire or Maddison (back when theyre still at Sheffield Utd & Norwich)? Those were very gettable targets and certainly be, had SAF still at the club.
